headline: Joe Rogan Says Warren Buffett, George Soros Are 'Not As Good As' Nancy Pelosi's Husband In Stock Trading, Thinks Politicians 'Know Something'
summary: Comedian Joe Rogan says U.S. politicians profit from insider knowledge when trading stocks. Rogan in February 2023 mentioned former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and her husband, Paul Pelosi, on his podcast "The Joe Rogan Experience" to highlight the advantage lawmakers may have when investing. He was discussing the stock trading activities of politicians with political commentators Krystal Ball and Saagar Enjeti. Don't Miss: The AI Marketing Platform Backed by Insiders from Google, Meta, and Amazo

headline: Zuckerberg insists Meta does not target children in landmark trial
summary: Mark Zuckerberg has denied in a landmark trial over social media addiction that his company’s apps target children.

content.title: Zuckerberg insists Meta does not target children in landmark trial
content.summary: Mark Zuckerberg has denied in a landmark trial over social media addiction that his company’s apps target children.

thumbnail.caption: Zuckerberg was shown internal emails that seemed to suggest his company was prioritising teenage users

headline: Meta's Zuckerberg denies at LA trial that Instagram targets kids
summary:
STORY: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg testified in court on Wednesday that the Facebook and Instagram operator does not allow kids under 13 on its platforms…

:: Mona Edwards

…despite being confronted with evidence suggesting they were a key demographic.

He took the stand as part of a landmark trial over youth social media addiction.

The case involves a California woman who started using Instagram and YouTube as a child. 

She alleges the companies sought to profit by hooking kids on their services, and claims the apps fueled her depression and suicidal thoughts.

Meta and Google have denied the allegations, and pointed to their work to add features that keep users safe.

Meanwhile, Meta's rivals Snap and TikTok settled with the plaintiff before the trial kicked off last week.

On Wednesday, Mark Lanier, a lawyer for the woman suing, confronted Zuckerberg with internal Meta documents.

He showed jurors emails from 2014 and 2015 in which Zuckerberg laid out aims to increase time spent on Instagram by double-digit percentage points. 

Zuckerberg said that while Meta previously had goals related to the amount of time users spent on the app, it has since changed its approach.

Meta faces potential damages at the jury trial in Los Angeles, part of a wave of litigation against social media companies in the U.S.

Cases there are beginning to go to trial amid a broader global backlash over the platforms' effect on young users.
